# Function name: R.Version
# Notes:
# .blue[`R.Version()`]
.center[.blue[`R.Version`]`()`]
+ .blue[`R.Version()`] returns a list of details about the version of that is currently running.
```{r eval=FALSE}
R.Version()
```
.center[.blue[`R.version.string`]]
+ .blue[`R.version.string`] is an easier to work with description of your version of R:
```{r eval=FALSE}
R.version.string
```
+ This is useful for extracting the version of R for publications: `stringr::word(R.version.string, 1, 3)`
---
